issue.title: Simple Note-Taking CLI App
issue.body:
## Overview
Build a simple command-line note-taking app in TypeScript.

## Requirements

### Features
1. Add a note with title and content
2. List all notes
3. Delete a note by ID
4. Search notes by keyword

### Technical
- TypeScript
- Store notes in a JSON file (notes.json)
- Use commander.js for CLI parsing
- Simple and clean code

### Commands
```
notes add --title "My Note" --content "Note content here"
notes list
notes delete --id 1
notes search --keyword "meeting"
```

### File Structure
```
src/
  index.ts    # CLI entry point
  notes.ts    # Note operations
  storage.ts  # JSON file storage
  types.ts    # TypeScript types
```

Keep it simple!

ems.task: Create project foundation: .gitignore, package.json with dependencies (commander.js, typescript, @types/node), tsconfig.json, and src/ folder structure

workers.task: Create .gitignore file with Node.js patterns (node_modules/, dist/, *.log, .env, notes.json) and package.json with project metadata, dependencies (commander, typescript, @types/node), and npm scripts (build, start)

Create tsconfig.json with TypeScript compiler options (target: ES2020, module: commonjs, outDir: ./dist, rootDir: ./src, strict: true, esModuleInterop: true) and create src/ directory structure with empty index.ts entry point

Create src/types.ts with Note interface (id: number, title: string, content: string, createdAt: string), src/storage.ts with JSON file operations (readNotes, writeNotes using fs.promises), and src/notes.ts with note operations (addNote, listNotes, deleteNote, searchNotes)

analysisSummary: Implement a TypeScript CLI note-taking app with add, list, delete, and search commands using commander.js and JSON file storage
